children.subject: Looking for more backend SWE right after graduation but am just interested in learning about frontend. Will it hinder recruiting if I don't take 162 and opt for 160 instead or is that ok in your eyes. Thanks!

Ah ok, I don't have experience with backend-specific SWE recruiting so I'm can't speak to that. I'm sure you can figure out the interviewing stuff with some LeetCode practice or something though. I do think 160 gives you a different focus on CS than you would normally experience in a backend role, so that could be interesting for you.
I'd recommend 162 for relevance to what you're looking for in a job, but taking courses you're interested in is also just as important IMO!
What kind of SWE are you interested in? If frontend then 160 is more relevant and important.

You can’t really “self-learn” the most core component of the 162 class which is working together on a tough project as a group. There’s concepts like debugging with the group and designing how to integrate your own individual code with other’s code which is not replicable in a self environment.

history.content: I'm graduating this summer so am taking my final CS major req this summer to do so. Initially I was set on taking 162 but the opportunity to take 160 came up and now I'm conflicted on which one to choose. I'm leaning towards 160 since I'm more interested in its material compared to 162 but I keep hearing that 162 is a "must take" if you plan on going the SWE path so I'm not 100% sure. I wanted to ask if it's plausible take 160 and just self-learn the 162 concepts (I've taken 100, 161, 170, 186, 188) on my own time or is 162 really a "must take" at Berkeley and I just drop 160? Any advice is appreciated!
history.subject: CS160 or CS162 for final major req?
